proof:
Proof. Consider arbitrary $F \in B_0$. First of all, as we showed in the proof of Lemma 51, for all d large enough, whp G is such that for any ordered F, $c(F) \le 1 + \eta n$. Let S be the set of vertices in non-giant components of $(V_c, F)$.
We now bound $w_c(F)/Z_c^{\mathrm{ord}}$ by considering two cases. If $c(F) - 1 \le |S| \le \eta n/2$, then using $Z_c^{\mathrm{ord}} \ge (e^\beta - 1)^{|E_c|}$ and $\beta \ge \beta_0$ we get
$$
\frac{w_c(F)}{Z_c^{\mathrm{ord}}} \le q^{\eta n/2}(e^\beta - 1)^{-|E_c \setminus F|} \le q^{\eta n/2 - \frac{19}{10d} \frac{9}{10}\eta |E_c|}
$$
Whp $|E_c| \ge \frac{dn}{2} - 2ne^{-d/3} \ge \frac{dn}{3}$ for all d large enough, thus giving $\frac{w_c(F)}{Z_c^{\mathrm{ord}}} \le q^{\eta n(1/2 - 57/100)} \le q^{-\eta n/10}$. Taking the aggregate sum over at most $2^{|E_c|} < 2^{dn}$ such configurations, we get that for all q sufficiently large, $\pi_c^{\mathrm{ord}}(B_0) \le e^{-n}$.
